title: Putting it all Together
content: The amount of damage an impact will cause is related to the object’s kinetic energy. Assume that astronomers have measured a velocity of 12900 m/s for your asteroid. The mass of the asteroid cannot be directly measured, but can be estimated by using its density and diameter. Since the composition of the asteroid is not known, we will assume this is a rocky asteroid (the most common type) with a density of 2500 kg/m3. So if you have an asteroid’s velocity, density, and diameter you can determine its kinetic energy, and therefore the amount of damage it would cause if it hit Earth.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: Input your values for velocity, density and diameter to estimate the impact energy (kinetic energy) of your asteroid, and the size of the crater it would leave, if it hit Earth.
